abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Results-Based Management and Budgeting Project is to
            establish that federal departments and agencies in Mexico
            provide decision makers and the public with rigorous,
            timely, user-friendly information on the efficiency and
            effectiveness of government organizations and program
            expenditures. This restructuring paper seeks the approval of
            the Executive Directors to amend the Project Development
            Objective (PDO) of the project by aligning the PDO to a
            reduced project scope and partial loan cancellation. The
            restructuring will also introduce the following changes: (i)
            the reduction in project scope as a result of changes in
            Government priorities and use of own resources; (ii) the
            revision to the results indicators to align the expected
            results with the activities that will be undertaken under
            the restructured project; (iii) the revision in project
            financing reflecting cancellation of US$12.756 million of
            the loan amount (from US$17.243 million to US$4.4866 million
            including the front-end fee) and revisions to the costs by
            component, financing plan and expenditure categories; and
            (iv) the revisions to the procurement plan and
            implementation schedule as result of the reduction in
            project scope and partial loan cancellation. The
            restructuring will allow achievement of the revised PDO and
            completion of the restructured project within the current
            closing date of December 31, 2013. These changes have been
            approved by management and discussed and agreed with the
            Government of Mexico. The restructuring does not trigger any
            new safeguard policies.
